articles.title: US passenger killed when big wave hits Antarctic cruise ship
articles.description: A U.S. woman was killed and four other passengers injured when a massive wave struck the Viking Polaris cruise ship while it was sailing toward the port of Ushuaia in southern Argentina on an Antarctic cruise, authorities said.The 62-year-old woman was hit by broken glass when the wave broke cabin windows late Tuesday during a […]

articles.title: FIFA World Cup 2022: Australia Coach Graham Arnold Relishing Argentina Encounter
articles.description: Arnold said underdogs Australia were inspired to face the two-time world champions led by Lionel Messi in their Round of 16 clash at the FIFA World Cup 2022 in Qatar
articles.content:
Australia coach Graham Arnold said his side were not intimidated by the might of football powerhouse Argentina ahead of their World Cup clash, insisting the South Americans “bring out the best in us".

articles.title: Argentina wary of 'very fast' Australia ahead of FIFA World Cup last-16 meeting
articles.description: Australia recovered from a shaky start against France to qualify for the knockouts on the back of 1-0 wins against Tunisia and Denmark and now face two-time champions Argentina in the last-16.
articles.content:
Doha: Argentina’s Rodrigo De Paul said the South American team are wary of Australia’s height and speed ahead of their World Cup last-16 clash in Doha on Saturday.

articles.title: Argentine exchange: early soy in core farm belt hit by drought, outlook dry

articles.title: Giant 'rogue wave' hits Antarctica-bound cruise ship, leaving one dead and four injured
articles.description: A "rogue wave" hit the Viking Polaris earlier this week – when the Antarctica cruise was heading to Ushiaia, Argentina, AFP reported.
articles.content:
One person died and four others were injured after a giant "rouge wave" hit an Antarctica-bound cruise ship, travel company Viking confirmed to multiple outlets.
